courses
Class Course

java.lang.Object
  courses.Course

public class Course
extends java.lang.Object

Contains information about a course like course title, level, number of credit hours, etc., but not information about a specific section like who teaches it. Courses are immutable.

Invariants:

  • getTitle() != null
  • getID() != null
  • getCredits() >= 0

Version:
May 30, 2011: added equals, hashcode, and toString., May 20, 2011: combined my_curriculum_code with my_level to be expressed by my_id., May 19, 2011: added credits field (thank you Steven Cozart for pointing the need out.), May 13, 2011: file created.
Author:
Jonathan Caddey

Constructor Detail

Course

public Course(java.lang.String the_id,
              java.lang.String the_title,
              int the_credits)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates a Course. For example, in "TCSS360 SOFTWARE DEV & QA," "TCSS360" is the course ID, and "SOFTWARE DEV & QA" is the title.

Parameters:
the_id - the unique identifier for the course.
the_title - the title of the course.
the_credits - the number of credit hours the course is worth.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the_id or the_title are null, or if the_credits is negative.
